Meski Boeing 737 MAX 8 Dikandangkan, Pesanan Lion Air Jalan Terus
01 Nov 2019, 08:41 by Herdi Alif Alhikam


Foto: Moehammad Bakrie/detikcom

Jakarta - Sejak Maret 2019 Indonesia 'mengandangkan' alias melakukan grounded pesawat Boeing 737 MAX 8. Penangguhan ini dilakukan imbas kecelakaan Lion Air JT-610.Lion Air menjadi salah satu maskapai yang memiliki armada MAX 8. Setidaknya, ada 10 pesawat milik Lion Air yang dikandangkan dan tidak beroperasi sejak Maret. Masih ada pesanan pesawat Lion yang belum dikirim ke Indonesia. Meski begitu, Managing Director Lion Air Group Daniel Putut menyatakan bahwa sisa pesawat yang belum dikirimkan tidak akan dibatalkan ataupun dialihkan jenis pesawatnya."Kita sudah jalin komunikasi yang baik. Belum sampai keputusan seperti itu (pembatalan atau pengalihan). Lebih baik kita menjaga hubungan baik kepada semua pihak," sebut Daniel di Kantor DKPPU Bandara Soetta, Jumat (1/11/2019).Lion Air sendiri masih memiliki ratusan sisa pesanan pesawat Boeing 737 MAX 8. Rinciannya, Lion memesan 220 pesawat MAX 8, 11 di antaranya sudah tiba namun sisanya masih belum dikirimkan. Dari 11 pesawat itu, satu pesawat hancur saat kecelakaan dan sisanya dikandangkan imbas kecelakaan.Daniel menambahkan, pengandangan pesawat ini jelas menimbulkan kerugian, baik kerugian operasional sampai potensi kehilangan keuntungan. Dia mengaku sudah intens berbicara dengan pihak Boeing soal kerugian ini. Menurutnya pabrikan pesawat asal Amerika Serikat ini akan memberikan kompensasi. Daniel pun memaparkan beberapa aspek yang akan diganti rugi oleh Boeing. Meski begitu, dia enggan menyebutkan berapa banyak yang diberikan Boeing."Mereka sudah berniat baik memberikan kompensasi. Macam-macam (kompensasinya) mulai dari training, perawatan, lost opportunity, lost profit. Kompensasinya ada, tapi itu kalau berapanya nggak bisa saya sebutkan," ucap Daniel. Simak Video "Terungkap! text:
Although Boeing 737 MAX 8 is grounded, Lion Air Orders continue
01 Nov 2019, 08:41 by Herdi Alif Alhikam


Photo: Moehammad Bakrie / detikcom

Jakarta - Since March 2019 Indonesia has 'grounded' alias grounded the Boeing 737 MAX 8. The suspension was carried out as a result of the Lion Air JT-610 accident. Lion Air has become one of the airlines that has a MAX 8 fleet. At least, there are 10 aircraft owned by Lion Air that locked up and has not been operating since March. There are still orders for Lion aircraft that have not been sent to Indonesia. Even so, Lion Air Group Managing Director Daniel Putut stated that the remaining aircraft that have not been sent will not be canceled or diverted by the type of aircraft. "We have established good communication. We have not reached a decision like that (cancellation or diversion). to all parties, "said Daniel at the Soetta Airport DKPPU Office, Friday (11/01/2019). Lion Air itself still has hundreds of remaining orders for Boeing 737 MAX 8. The details, Lion ordered 220 MAX 8 aircraft, 11 of which have arrived but the rest hasn't been sent. Of the 11 planes, one aircraft was destroyed in an accident and the rest was imprisoned by an accident. Danielel added, the sighting of this aircraft clearly caused losses, both operational losses to the potential loss of profits. He admitted that he had intensely talked to Boeing about this loss. According to him the aircraft manufacturer from the United States will provide compensation. Daniel also explained several aspects that would be compensated by Boeing. Even so, he was reluctant to mention how much was given by Boeing. "They have good intentions to provide compensation. Kinds (compensation) ranging from training, maintenance, lost opportunity, lost profit. The compensation is there, but if I don't mention how much I can say, "said Daniel.
